title: The Control revolution
creator_credit: Richard Moore, National Educational Television and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
brief_description: Explains how the development of the computer has made possible the automatic control of routine tasks in government, industry and business. Presents various computer systems ranging from data processing applications to mechanical control systems. Introduces basic concepts in business information systems including feedback, decision making processes and data modelling.
